docs.snippet: The 2014 World Cup has dispelled one of sports’ most entrenched (if somewhat mythical) beliefs: that Brazilian soccer is a showcase of tempo and timbre designed, above all else, to enthrall and entertain....
docs.lead_paragraph: The 2014 World Cup has dispelled one of sports’ most entrenched (if somewhat mythical) beliefs: that Brazilian soccer is a showcase of tempo and timbre designed, above all else, to enthrall and entertain.
docs.abstract: Sam Borden On Soccer column notes that Brazil's performance at 2014 World Cup has produced wins, albeit lacking the supposed style team is known for.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: Brazil Eschews ‘The Beautiful Game’ for a More Rugged Style
headline.print_headline: The Beautiful Game? A Pretty Memory

docs.snippet: It takes years for a fine wine to mature and the Germany team that ripped Brazil apart 7-1 in an astonishing World Cup semi-final has become a rare vintage with coach Joachim Loew finally getting the blend right....
docs.lead_paragraph: It takes years for a fine wine to mature and the Germany team that ripped Brazil apart 7-1 in an astonishing World Cup semi-final has become a rare vintage with coach Joachim Loew finally getting the blend right.

docs.snippet: When Argentina plays the Netherlands in the World Cup semifinals on Wednesday, it will be a matchup of arguably the two best attacks in the tournament. No less than five of the world's best forwards could be on the field, which would normally rais...
docs.lead_paragraph: When Argentina plays the Netherlands in the World Cup semifinals on Wednesday, it will be a matchup of arguably the two best attacks in the tournament. No less than five of the world's best forwards could be on the field, which would normally raise expectations of a flurry of goals and end-to-end attacking football.

headline.main: Netherlands vs Argentina: How They Compare
headline.print_headline: Netherlands vs Argentina: How They Compare

docs.snippet: Even for an 84-year-old tournament drenched in history, Germany 7, Brazil 1 — you read that right — will be remembered as one of the craziest World Cup matches ever. Because of the humiliation it inflicted on a great footballing nation...
docs.lead_paragraph: Even for an 84-year-old tournament drenched in history, Germany 7, Brazil 1 — you read that right — will be remembered as one of the craziest World Cup matches ever. Because of the humiliation it inflicted on a great footballing nation, as one of the most painful to watch, too.

headline.main: Column: Disaster's Branding Iron Burns Brazil Anew
